citations.narrative:
There was not a 7005 form completed for the dog hybrids at the time of inspection. Acquisition and disposition records are
necessary to be able to accurately track animals being used in regulated activities to ensure their legal acquisition, proper
care, and humane transportation.
Each dealer and exhibitor shall use Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS Form 7005) and Record of
Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS Form 7006) to make, keep, and maintain the information required by paragraph
(a)(1) of this section.
Correct by November 13, 2023

On records review, it could not be substantiated that each of the dog hybrids had received an annual head to tail
examination; no medical records were available except one showing vaccinations given to the dog hybrids on 2-17-2022.
Annual physical examinations are necessary to assess the health of the dogs to identify health issues in a timely manner
for greater chance of treatment success. Medical records for the dog hybrids must be available for review at time of
inspection.
A complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian is required not less than once
every 12 months.
Correct by November 30, 2023

On records review it was found that 2 wolf hybrids, Lupin and Rogue, were overdue for their Rabies vaccinations. They
should have received their Rabies booster by 2-16-2023 but did not. All seven dog hybrids were overdue for their annual
DA2PP+CVP+L and Bordetella; the last vaccinations were given on 2-17-2022. There was no parasite sampling,
(heartworm or intestinal parasites), performed in the last 12 months which is required to be included in the written
program of veterinary care.
Failure to provide preventive medical care can result in breakthrough infections or failure to detect parasite infestations
caused by drug resistance. All required vaccinations must be kept up to date per written PVC and parasite sampling
performed annually.
Vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs (including rabies, parvovirus and distemper) and sampling
and treatment of parasites and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) must be completed
annually in accordance with the requirements of the PVC for dogs.
Correct by November 30, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Executive Director.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
There was not a 7005 form completed for the dog hybrids at the time of inspection. Acquisition and disposition records are 
necessary to be able to accurately track animals being used in regulated activities to ensure their legal acquisition, proper 
care, and humane transportation.  
 
Each dealer and exhibitor shall use Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS Form 7005) and Record of 
Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS Form 7006) to make, keep, and maintain the information required by paragraph 
(a)(1) of this section. 
 
Correct by November 13, 2023 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
On records review, it could not be substantiated that each of the dog hybrids had received an annual head to tail 
examination; no medical records were available except one showing vaccinations given to the dog hybrids on 2-17-2022.  
 
Annual physical examinations are necessary to assess the health of the dogs to identify health issues in a timely manner 
for greater chance of treatment success. Medical records for the dog hybrids must be available for review at time of 
inspection.  
 
A complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian is required not less than once 
every 12 months. 
 
Correct by November 30, 2023 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs.

On records review it was found that 2 wolf hybrids, Lupin and Rogue, were overdue for their Rabies vaccinations. They 
should have received their Rabies booster by 2-16-2023 but did not. All seven dog hybrids were overdue for their annual 
DA2PP+CVP+L and Bordetella; the last vaccinations were given on 2-17-2022. There was no parasite sampling, 
(heartworm or intestinal parasites), performed in the last 12 months which is required to be included in the written 
program of veterinary care. 
 
Failure to provide preventive medical care can result in breakthrough infections or failure to detect parasite infestations 
caused by drug resistance. All required vaccinations must be kept up to date per written PVC and parasite sampling 
performed annually. 
 
Vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs (including rabies, parvovirus and distemper) and sampling 
and treatment of parasites and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) must be completed 
annually in accordance with the requirements of the PVC for dogs. 
 
Correct by November 30, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Executive Director.
